channel.title: Trying out Cinematic Mod
channel.description:
Sooo, I got it into my head to give Cinematic Mod for Half Life a try.
I've read several comments of people saying that, if you configure it correctly, the character models will stay true to the original.
I want to experience Half life in pimped up graphics, but without too many changes to the game itself. So no porn actress Alyx, no blue zombies, no fresh out of hollywood rebels.
Can anybody who has experience with Cinematic Mod suggest what version to install and how to configure it?

item.title: Trying out Cinematic Mod
item.dc:creator: Kaweebo
item.description:
Orpheon:

Basically, because the mod turns the game into his own idea of Half-Life.

I do have to agree, the HD models are easily turned off, but some other junk I had to dig around the files to remove, like in the picture frame that’s supposed to hold just Eli’s family picture, in CM10 has a picture of some model, with the family picture smaller, and clipped in the corner. In fact, the folder that holds that picture of the model is just labeled ‘porn’. Reaction: ‘Delete’

Read full topic

item.title: Trying out Cinematic Mod
item.dc:creator: TheSuperNova
item.description:
Aze:

Because Half Life 2 is as good as it is, there are no super sexy perfect body models with almost no clothes, every character looks like a normal man or woman, that gives the atmosphere. Also, MOSSMANS ASS! Have you seen how unscaled it is?!

You clearly didn’t read my post, I do not use the hd models, because they are shit, and no one has to use them they are an optional part of the mod, lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Trying out Cinematic Mod
item.dc:creator: Aze
item.description:
TheSuperNova:

I don’t get why people hate this mod so much, It’s a really nice graphical improvement, granted i don’t use the hd models, but seriously what the fuck is the problem?

Because Half Life 2 is as good as it is, there are no super sexy perfect body models with almost no clothes, every character looks like a normal man or woman, that gives the atmosphere. Also, MOSSMANS ASS! Have you seen how unscaled it is?!

Read full topic

item.title: Trying out Cinematic Mod
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
Game engines are always more capable than they look, however, games have to be built with certain restrictions in mind.

That’s why technical demos always look better than the games built on that tech.

Read full topic

item.title: Trying out Cinematic Mod
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
BM looks just as good as Cinematic Mod

this is quite true actually.

Vanilla HL2 is quite outdated on project level. Source can do more - cinematic mod is a proof of concept.

Read full topic

item.title: Trying out Cinematic Mod
item.dc:creator: Jack_Freeman
item.description:
Aze:

What’s with Mossmans ass? It looks bad, really bad…

Lol.

You revived this thread just for saying that?

On topic:
I would like to try CM9 but i don’t know if my current pc can run it properly without too much lag.
Specs:

CPU: AMD athlon 2650e 1.60 ghz.
GPU: ATI Radeon 2100 1024 mb VRAM.
Ram: 4 gb ddr2.
OS: Windows 7 ultimate 64-bit.

Read full topic

item.title: Trying out Cinematic Mod
item.dc:creator: Luciel
item.description:
Dotard:

Yeah with original models its playable but still … a lot of bugs and stupid tweaks

True, but I found it was a cool way of playing HL2 which now looks kind of outdated with more modern graphs (“now with more shiny!”) : ), also, to be fair, on CM10 (i think that was the version I was playing) there´s a options panel (outside of the game) that lets you tweak what models to use, and all sorts of options, which is good because this way you can keep it original, but looking better.

Read full topic

item.title: Trying out Cinematic Mod
item.dc:creator: Dotard
item.description:
Yeah with original models its playable but still … a lot of bugs and stupid tweaks

Read full topic

item.title: Trying out Cinematic Mod
item.dc:creator: Luciel
item.description:
I actually played HL2 + EP1 + EP2 from start to finish on the last lan party I went to, with triplehead 5040x1050 with CM, I found I had loads of people behind me looking for hours, it really does improve the game with big resolutions like this, I did however, keep the original character models, was quite an experience.

Read full topic
